scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection includes Southern Pacific dispatcher's daily train sheets and correspondence, a memorandum and a map regarding the sheets. The sheets are a sampling from three stations (Los Angeles, Beaumont, and Mexicali, Baja).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Southern Pacific Transportation Company Records, JL015, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Southern Pacific Transportation Company to the Jackson Library of Business, 1970. Transferred to the Department of Special Collections in 1979.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and date re: Dispatcher's correspondence between Mr. David Myrick of the Treasury Dept. of the Southern Pacific Transportation Co., who sent the Dispatcher's sheets, and Ms. Marion Smith: a. letter to Ms. Smith 12/9/69 promising and identifying dispatches, b. 2nd letter to Ms. Smith 1/28/70 accompanying sheets, c. a five page memorandum “explaining purpose of Dispatcher's Train sheets, describing L.A. Division of Southern Pacific Co., and pointing out some changes in railroad operations in L.A. Division as reflected in Sheets”, d. map of L.A. Division (revised Jan. 1, 1954).
